Options.Name: optCbStartingLabors
Options.Tooltip: You can have your dwarves start/arrive without any labor types enabled here by setting this to NO.  You can also set it to SKILLS to make the labor list set by skill, or BY_UNIT_TYPE to have it done by overall unit type.

Options.Name: optBtnTemperature
Options.Tooltip: Turns temperature on or off. OFF helps FPS extremely, although robs you of many game features.

Options.Name: optBtnWeather
Options.Tooltip: Turn weather on or off. Rain might be useful to fill ponds. OFF helps FPS.

Options.Name: optBtnCaveins
Options.Tooltip: Turn cave-in physics on or off. No more injured miners, but also no cave-in traps... your choice.

Options.Name: optBtnInvaders
Options.Tooltip: Turn invaders completely on or off. Might rob you of !FUN!

Options.Name: optBtnLiquidDepth
Options.Tooltip: Turn Liquid depth on or off, as you like.

Options.Name: optBtnAdvCenter
Options.Tooltip: Decides if the camera always centers on your adventurer or not.

Options.Name: optBtnAdvTraps
Options.Tooltip: Decides if you adventurer is affected by traps or not.

Options.Name: optBtnPetCoffins
Options.Tooltip: Enable to disallow pets from coffin burial as the default option.

Options.Name: optNumPopCap
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 9999  Set the amount of maximum dwarves. Mind that min. 2 migrant waves will appear.

Options.Name: optMaskChildBabyCap
Options.Tooltip: ####:####  The first number is an absolute cap on babies + children. The second is a percentage of the current number of adults.

Options.Name: optBtnAutoSavePause
Options.Tooltip: Pauses after auto-saving.

Options.Name: optBtnAutoBackup
Options.Tooltip: These saves will be stored in a new folder, automatically

Options.Name: optBtnEmbarkSave
Options.Tooltip: Save at embark.

Options.Name: optBtnCompressSaves
Options.Tooltip: Compress saves to reduce file sizes.

Options.Name: optBtnPauseLoad
Options.Tooltip: Paused when you load an old game.

Options.Name: optBtnTransformMsgs
Options.Tooltip: Stops the game and tells you whenever a creature transforms. Great for spotting important events, but might slow down the game flow. Your choice, of course.

Options.Name: optBtnDigStop
Options.Tooltip: Turn this OFF to remove the pause/recenter when you find damp/hot stones.

Options.Name: optNumMacro
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 999999  This controls the number of milliseconds between macro instructions.

Options.Name: optCbWindow
Options.Tooltip: Switches from windowed to full-screen mode.

Options.Name: optCbPriority
Options.Tooltip: Determines how much processor time should be allocated to Dwarf Fortress.

Options.Name: optBtnIntro
Options.Tooltip: Turns the intro video on or off. OFF leads to a faster start-up.

Options.Name: optBtnEmbarkWarn
Options.Tooltip: If enabled, shows a warning before every embark, even if there are no issues.

Options.Name: optMaskEmbarkSize
Options.Tooltip: #:# (# is 1-16)  For a 1:1 embark, nanofortress must be applied!

Options.Name: optCbPrintMode
Options.Tooltip: 2D needed for TrueType, STANDARD needed for Rendermax.

Options.Name: optBtnSprites
Options.Tooltip: Adds custom sprites for creatures. Disable to play with characters only.

Options.Name: optBtnTruetype
Options.Tooltip: Toggle Truetype On/Off. You can do this with F12 while the game is running as well.

Options.Name: optBtnRendermax
Options.Tooltip: Enables the dfhack plugin. You can always disable it while playing with 'rendermax disable' in your dfhack window. Currently you can only have either Rendermax or TTF active and it requires print mode STANDARD.

Options.Name: optBtnSound
Options.Tooltip: Turn sound on or off.

Options.Name: optBtnFps
Options.Tooltip: Shows the current FPS on top left.

Options.Name: optNumGFPS
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 9999  How fast the game visually updates.

Options.Name: optNumFPSCap
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 9999  How fast the game runs.

Options.Name: optBtnCivDwarves
Options.Tooltip: Adds playable Dwarven Civ.

Options.Name: optBtnCivOrcs
Options.Tooltip: Adds taiga orcs to the world.

Options.Name: optBtnCivKobolds
Options.Tooltip: Adds a cutebold civilization to the world.

Options.Name: optBtnGnomes
Options.Tooltip: Adds gnomes to trade with to your game. They will arrive late in the game and only in summer.

Options.Name: optBtnWarlocks
Options.Tooltip: Add foul sorcerers that fight you with magic.

Options.Name: optBtnHumanRace
Options.Tooltip: Adds humans to trade with to your game.

Options.Name: optBtnElfRace
Options.Tooltip: Adds elves to trade with to your game.

Options.Name: optBtnDrowRace
Options.Tooltip: Adds drow to trade with to your game.

Options.Name: optBtnGoblins
Options.Tooltip: You want to be ambushed by little goblins ? Here you go.

Options.Name: optBtnFrostGiants
Options.Tooltip: Bored and ready for a challenge ? Let the Giants invade your base.

Options.Name: optBtnAutomatons
Options.Tooltip: Add a relentless metal race that fights with adv. ranged weapons.

Options.Name: optBtnGremlins
Options.Tooltip: Be careful in the caverns...

Options.Name: optBtnTroglodytes
Options.Tooltip: More ambushers await you in the deep...

Options.Name: optBtnAntmen
Options.Tooltip: Antmen camp in large numbers in the caverns...

Options.Name: optBtnEvilDwarves
Options.Tooltip: Adds a dwarven invader race to the game.

Options.Name: optBtnEvilHumans
Options.Tooltip: Adds a human invader race to the game.

Options.Name: optBtnEvilDrow
Options.Tooltip: Adds a drow invader race to the game.

Options.Name: optBtnEvilElves
Options.Tooltip: Adds an elven  invader race to the game.

Options.Name: optBtnDomesticPets
Options.Tooltip: Adds new pets available through trading and at embark.

Options.Name: optBtnMoreVermin
Options.Tooltip: Adds custom vermin. Some spin webs and are useful, others eat your food away.

Options.Name: optBtnMoreGiantAnimals
Options.Tooltip: Yes keeps giant animal versions in-game. NO removes them.

Options.Name: optBtnMoreMegaBeasts
Options.Tooltip: Adds 25 new semi/megabeasts to the game.

Options.Name: optBtnMoreBirds
Options.Tooltip: Adds or removes +100 bird species to the game, including animal man and giant versions.

Options.Name: optBtnMoreFish
Options.Tooltip: Adds custom fish to pools, oceans and rivers.

Options.Name: optBtnMoreAnimalmen
Options.Tooltip: Yes keeps animal-man versions in-game. NO removes them.

Options.Name: optBtnMoreCavernCreatures
Options.Tooltip: Adds 70 new monsters to fight in the caverns.

Options.Name: optBtnMoreSurfaceCreatures
Options.Tooltip: Adds about 115  surface monsters to fight.

Options.Name: optBtnMoreDemons
Options.Tooltip: Adds custom demons to fight in Hell.

Options.Name: optBtnMoreMagical
Options.Tooltip: Adds about 35 magic-based and otherwise unrealistic creatures to the game.

Options.Name: optCbPatternInvaderSkills
Options.Tooltip: This sets the combat skills for the above races. Be careful not to underestimate the effects of higher skills!

Options.Name: optBtnFdFrogmen
Options.Tooltip: Adds a Fortress Defense race to lay siege to your fortress.

Options.Name: optBtnFdFireImps
Options.Tooltip: Adds a Fortress Defense race to lay siege to your fortress.

Options.Name: optBtnFdStranglers
Options.Tooltip: Adds a Fortress Defense race to lay siege to your fortress.

Options.Name: optBtnFdWerewolfs
Options.Tooltip: Adds a Fortress Defense race to lay siege to your fortress.

Options.Name: optBtnFdBlendecs
Options.Tooltip: Adds a Fortress Defense race to lay siege to your fortress.

Options.Name: optBtnFdSerpentmen
Options.Tooltip: Adds a Fortress Defense race to lay siege to your fortress.

Options.Name: optBtnFdWhiteTigermen
Options.Tooltip: Adds a Fortress Defense race to lay siege to your fortress.

Options.Name: optBtnFdBeakWolfs
Options.Tooltip: Adds a Fortress Defense race to lay siege to your fortress.

Options.Name: optBtnFdElephants
Options.Tooltip: Adds a Fortress Defense race to lay siege to your fortress.

Options.Name: optBtnFdFerricElves
Options.Tooltip: Adds a Fortress Defense race to lay siege to your fortress.

Options.Name: optBtnFdGreatBadgermen
Options.Tooltip: Adds a Fortress Defense race to lay siege to your fortress.

Options.Name: optBtnFdPandashi
Options.Tooltip: Adds a Fortress Defense race to lay siege to your fortress.

Options.Name: optBtnFdRaptormen
Options.Tooltip: Adds a Fortress Defense race to lay siege to your fortress.

Options.Name: optBtnFdHarpies
Options.Tooltip: Adds a Fortress Defense race to lay siege to your fortress.

Options.Name: optBtnFdMinotaurs
Options.Tooltip: Adds a Fortress Defense race to lay siege to your fortress.

Options.Name: optBtnFdJotun
Options.Tooltip: Adds a Fortress Defense race to lay siege to your fortress.

Options.Name: optBtnFdSpiderFiends
Options.Tooltip: Adds a Fortress Defense race to lay siege to your fortress.

Options.Name: optBtnFdNightwings
Options.Tooltip: Adds a Fortress Defense race to lay siege to your fortress.

Options.Name: optBtnSteamEngine
Options.Tooltip: Creates power to be used in machines. Needs water and fuel to work.

Options.Name: optBtnMachineFactory
Options.Tooltip: Build your own turrets, land mines and guardians. (BUGGY but cant be done better for the moment)

Options.Name: optBtnLiquidSpawner
Options.Tooltip: Unlocking the liquid spawner unlocks magma workshops as well. Can spawn water or magma.

Options.Name: optBtnCoinMint
Options.Tooltip: Mints large stacks of copper, silver or gold coins.

Options.Name: optBtnBonecarver
Options.Tooltip: Makes bone items and allows alternate metal productions.

Options.Name: optBtnStonecrafter
Options.Tooltip: Allows the creation of rock items. Great for the start.

Options.Name: optBtnGemcutter
Options.Tooltip: Allows the creation of gem items. Lets you cut big gems into smaller ones as well.

Options.Name: optBtnWoodcrafter
Options.Tooltip: Uses wooden planks to create new items.

Options.Name: optBtnThatchery
Options.Tooltip: Allows the creation of furniture from plant materials, from wicker.

Options.Name: optBtnFurnitureWorkshop
Options.Tooltip: 'Allow the creation of complete itemsets, made of rock, wood, bone or metal.

Options.Name: optBtnTailor
Options.Tooltip: Select specific silk, cloth, leather, shell, scale or chitin for clothing and armor.

Options.Name: optBtnChandler
Options.Tooltip: Creates torches and candles for the rendermax lighting creation buildings.

Options.Name: optBtnFletcher
Options.Tooltip: Makes special ammo and upgrades ranged weapons.

Options.Name: optBtnPottery
Options.Tooltip: Makes clay, fire-clay or kaolinite items, which need to be dried and fired before they can be used.

Options.Name: optBtnGreatDyer
Options.Tooltip: Allows dyeing of finished items. You can select the type and material one by one.

Options.Name: optBtnPainter
Options.Tooltip: Colors furniture using dye, allows for easy color coding of your fort.

Options.Name: optBtnToolmaker
Options.Tooltip: Creates basic tools for advanced buildings. You will want to keep this building.

Options.Name: optBtnPrison
Options.Tooltip: Lock away specific dwarves for a specific time.

Options.Name: optBtnColosseum
Options.Tooltip: Summon enemies to train your soldiers or fight for glory.

Options.Name: optBtnGuildhall
Options.Tooltip: Dwarves can join guilds to get a 200% bonus in learn rate for fitting skills. If disabled, this removes all labor related castes!

Options.Name: optBtnMonastery
Options.Tooltip: Allows dwarves to join the religious castes and creates construction materials for temples. If disabled, this removes the religious castes!

Options.Name: optBtnGarrison
Options.Tooltip: Dwarves can join military groups which gives a 200% learning bonus to military skills. If disabled, this removes all military castes!

Options.Name: optBtnWeightBench
Options.Tooltip: Trains attributes of your dwarves, like strength, endurance and agility.

Options.Name: optBtnStorage
Options.Tooltip: Allows the unpacking of crates from caravans.

Options.Name: optBtnWoodsplitting
Options.Tooltip: Little brother of the sawmill, cuts wood into planks and can smooth some types of wood. Very basic, early workshop.

Options.Name: optBtnScriptorium
Options.Tooltip: Write books to read in libraries, copy research discoveries.

Options.Name: optBtnLibraries
Options.Tooltip: Adds 6 Library section in which your dwarves can read to train their skills.

Options.Name: optBtnBrewery
Options.Tooltip: Allows the refining of alcoholic drinks with sugar. New drinks have special effects..

Options.Name: optBtnSawmill
Options.Tooltip: Cuts wooden logs into 4 blocks to be used in constructions and refines farmed trees.

Options.Name: optBtnFishpond
Options.Tooltip: Indoor fishing area for your fisherdwarves. Great for waterless maps.

Options.Name: optBtnSlaughterhouse
Options.Tooltip: Take megabeast corpses apart for special rewards.

Options.Name: optBtnStables
Options.Tooltip: Allows the indoor feeding of grazers.

Options.Name: optBtnEmbassy
Options.Tooltip: Invite diplomats or traders and challenge beasts and civilizations.

Options.Name: optBtnExpedition
Options.Tooltip: Send expeditions, raiding parties, diplomats and bards throughout the world.

Options.Name: optBtnPodium
Options.Tooltip: Hold speeches to influence nearby dwarves and give them permanent mental attribute boosts.

Options.Name: optBtnResearch
Options.Tooltip: Conduct research to unlock new buildings and furnaces.

Options.Name: optBtnArcheology
Options.Tooltip: Adds Archeologist and fossils. Excavates fossils and creates special items.

Options.Name: optBtnApothecary
Options.Tooltip: Adds a workshop for your hospital. Creates casts, crutches, splints, soap and empties out buckets.

Options.Name: optBtnBiology
Options.Tooltip: Takes invader corpses and might research a permanent bonus against a specific race.

Options.Name: optBtnAltar
Options.Tooltip: Adds the Altar of Armok. Allow your dwarves to pray to Armok for help.

Options.Name: optBtnShrine
Options.Tooltip: Adds the Shrine of Armok. Allow your dwarves to pray to Armok for help.

Options.Name: optBtnTemple
Options.Tooltip: Adds the Temple of Armok. Allow your dwarves to pray to Armok for help.

Options.Name: optBtnTavern
Options.Tooltip: Play music with different instruments to boost your dwarves. Also allows basic gambling and tavern brawls.

Options.Name: optBtnOlon
Options.Tooltip: A trader to buy/sell items for coins. Olon handles food.

Options.Name: optBtnBomrek
Options.Tooltip: A trader to buy/sell items for coins. Bomrek handles basic materials.

Options.Name: optBtnUrist
Options.Tooltip: A trader to buy/sell items for coins. Urist handles weapons and armors.

Options.Name: optBtnTeduk
Options.Tooltip: A trader to buy/sell items for coins. Teduk handles expensive goods.

Options.Name: optBtnIneri
Options.Tooltip: A trader to buy creatures for coins. Ineri specializes in pets.

Options.Name: optBtnAlchemy
Options.Tooltip: Allows transmutation of metals, the creation of gems and special metals. as well as magma and water.

Options.Name: optBtnToxicology
Options.Tooltip: Coat weapons, ammo or traps with different poisons.

Options.Name: optBtnChemistry
Options.Tooltip: Adds chemistry to the game. Mostly used for explosives and acids.

Options.Name: optBtnHerbalist
Options.Tooltip: Refines special plants and woods into useful items and materials for your fort.

Options.Name: optBtnBrazier
Options.Tooltip: Adds a way to make fire, light pipes and create light.

Options.Name: optBtnCandelabra
Options.Tooltip: Adds a way to make fire, light pipes and create light.

Options.Name: optBtnFireplace
Options.Tooltip: Adds a way to make fire, light pipes and create light.

Options.Name: optBtnTorchbearerStatue
Options.Tooltip: Adds a way to make fire, light pipes and create light.

Options.Name: optBtnGemOfLight
Options.Tooltip: Creates a lot of light.

Options.Name: optBtnAmmocaster
Options.Tooltip: Create several new types of ammo in this furnace.

Options.Name: optBtnGunsmith
Options.Tooltip: Adds a gunsmith. You can now create gunpowder and several guns.

Options.Name: optBtnHeavySiegeworks
Options.Tooltip: Adds the ability to make exploding ballista bolts, metal ballistae and catapults and more.

Options.Name: optBtnEngineer
Options.Tooltip: A workshop to upgrade your traps. Only needed if you play with: Weaker trap ON.

Options.Name: optBtnInventor
Options.Tooltip: Invent foreign weapons, shields or armors and copy existing models of them. Can make copies of leather, metal or gem.

Options.Name: optBtnGreatforge
Options.Tooltip: Forges two-handed weapons, kite shields and armor sets.

Options.Name: optBtnGlassforge
Options.Tooltip: Create all kinds of items made of glass.

Options.Name: optBtnGemforge
Options.Tooltip: Allows the creation of gem weapons and armor. Lets you cut big gems into smaller ones as well.

Options.Name: optBtnRockForge
Options.Tooltip: Allows the creation of rock weapons, ammo and basic armor. Great for the start.

Options.Name: optBtnGolemForge
Options.Tooltip: Allows to cast dwarves into mighty metal warriors.

Options.Name: optBtnGreatMagmaForge
Options.Tooltip: Merge several metals into volcanic metal.

Options.Name: optBtnBrickOven
Options.Tooltip: Creates 8 types of colorful blocks. Great for mega-projects.

Options.Name: optBtnCrematorium
Options.Tooltip: Allows the cremation of corpses, body parts and items to regain ash and coke.

Options.Name: optMultiOreProcessor
Options.Tooltip: Separate the ore from rock, allowing greater yield before smelting ores. Also reduces slag and gives free stone.

Options.Name: optBtnKiln
Options.Tooltip: Glaze porcelain, stone and earthware. Create pearlash, gypsum powder, tobacco, hay and more.

Options.Name: optBtnSlagPit
Options.Tooltip: Clear up slag waste products from metal fabrication.

Options.Name: optBtnMagicSchool
Options.Tooltip: Turns dwarves into arcane dwarves and unlocks magic altars. If disabled, this also removes all mage castes!

Options.Name: optBtnElementalMagic
Options.Tooltip: 4 new buildings: Fire, Water, Earth and Air based magic altars to train your mages and do much more.

Options.Name: optBtnWhiteMagic
Options.Tooltip: White magic based on good biomes for 3 unique mages and resurrections.

Options.Name: optBtnBlackMagic
Options.Tooltip: Black magic based on evil biomes for 3 unique mages and raising the undead, vampires, demons and more.

Options.Name: optBtnWarpstonePool
Options.Tooltip: Use warpstone to mutate matter into forgotten beasts.

Options.Name: optBtnRuneArmory
Options.Tooltip: Enchant armors with metal runes for special effects on the wearer.

Options.Name: optBtnRuneWeaponry
Options.Tooltip: Enchant weapons with runes, to allow special effects.

Options.Name: optBtnArmory
Options.Tooltip: Upgrades any armor to the best armor in the game, plate-mail.

Options.Name: optBtnWeaponry
Options.Tooltip: Upgrade all available weapons to an improved version. Has a small chance for a legendary version.

Options.Name: optBtnMegabeastKennel
Options.Tooltip: Train a dwarf to an epic fighter or revive a megabeast by using its soul as reagent. Needs megabeasts and the slaughterhouse.

Options.Name: optBtnWarKennel
Options.Tooltip: Allows to outfit a selection of pets with steel plating.

Options.Name: optBtnDisplayCase
Options.Tooltip: Adds display cases. Raise room value or decorate your fortress.

Options.Name: optBtnPottedPlant
Options.Tooltip: Adds a potted plant as decoration.

Options.Name: optBtnTotems
Options.Tooltip: Adds two buildable totems to the game, just for the looks.

Options.Name: optBtnFountain
Options.Tooltip: Adds a small fountain as decoration for your fortress.

Options.Name: optBtnDwarvenLoo
Options.Tooltip: Adds a toilet, for those that always wondered where dwarves do their business. Can clean buckets and other containers.

Options.Name: optBtnCarpet
Options.Tooltip: Adds several tiles for indoor decoration.

Options.Name: optBtnDecoItems
Options.Tooltip: Adds many new items for dwarven rooms. Use this only with Masterwork Tileset.

Options.Name: optBtnStatues
Options.Tooltip: Adds 4 new statues to the game, demon, beast, skeleton and golem statue.

Options.Name: optBtnBlastFurnace
Options.Tooltip: Mass smelting of ore.

Options.Name: optBtnCrucible
Options.Tooltip: Refine more advanced minerals here.

Options.Name: optBtnFinishingForge
Options.Tooltip: Cold-hammer copper, tin and bronze for an early army.

Options.Name: optBtnMetallurgist
Options.Tooltip: All alloys are created in this workshop.

Options.Name: optBtnArbalest
Options.Tooltip: A new siege engine that fires rapidly at your foes.

Options.Name: optBtnTrebuchet
Options.Tooltip: A new siege engines that fires slow AoE damage at your foes.

Options.Name: optBtnClayOven
Options.Tooltip: Adds several reactions to the kiln and quern about glazing. See the manual for full details.

Options.Name: optBtnCrafts
Options.Tooltip: Adds several new reactions to the craftsman. See manual for full detail.

Options.Name: optBtnQuenMill
Options.Tooltip: Adds several new reactions to the quern and millstone. See manual for full detail.

Options.Name: optBtnMillstone
Options.Tooltip: Adds rock, sand and bone grinding to the millstone.

Options.Name: optBtnStill
Options.Tooltip: Adds several new reactions to the still. See manual for full detail.

Options.Name: optBtnKitchen
Options.Tooltip: Adds several new reactions to the kitchen. See manual for full detail.

Options.Name: optBtnTanner
Options.Tooltip: Adds several new reactions to the tanner. See manual for full detail.

Options.Name: optBtnScrewPress
Options.Tooltip: Adds several new reactions to the screw press. See manual for full detail.

Options.Name: optBtnSoapmaker
Options.Tooltip: Adds or removes the soapmaker building. Regardless of its existence the chemists will still make soap.

Options.Name: optBtnSimpleTrees
Options.Tooltip: Enable to play with fewer tree types. Good for FPS.

Options.Name: optBtnSimpleGems
Options.Tooltip: Enable to play with fewer gem types. Good for FPS.

Options.Name: optBtnSimpleSoil
Options.Tooltip: Enable to play with only one type of sand, soil and clay. Good for FPS.

Options.Name: optBtnSimpleStones
Options.Tooltip: Enable to play with fewer stone types. Good for FPS.

Options.Name: optBtnSimpleMetals
Options.Tooltip: Enable to play with fewer mineral types. Good for FPS.

Options.Name: optMultiSimpleWood
Options.Tooltip: Enable for standardized wood. Disable for every tree to use specific wood names.

Options.Name: optBtnSimplePets
Options.Tooltip: Enable to remove redundant domestic pets. Helps FPS.

Options.Name: optMultiSimpleMeat
Options.Tooltip: Enable to standardize all butchery products to one type of meat.

Options.Name: optBtnSimpleGemShapes
Options.Tooltip: Reduces all gem and stone cut shapes to oval cabochons.

Options.Name: optBtnDigging
Options.Tooltip: Allows forgotten beasts and some invaders to dig into your fort.

Options.Name: optMultiRazing
Options.Tooltip: Allows titans and some invaders to destroy buildings and walls.

Options.Name: optBtnMoreTrees
Options.Tooltip: Adds +120 different kinds of trees to the game.

Options.Name: optBtnMorePlants
Options.Tooltip: Adds +180 different plants to the game.

Options.Name: optBtnFoodNames
Options.Tooltip: Adds more names for prepared meals, thats it.

Options.Name: optBtnFearTheNight
Options.Tooltip: Adds custom vampires, were-beasts, necromancers and curses to the game.

Options.Name: optBtnAquifier
Options.Tooltip: Turn Aquifer on or off, as you like.

Options.Name: optMultiHarderSmithing
Options.Tooltip: Makes smithing harder. Items might need more then just one bar of metal to be produced.

Options.Name: optMultiHarderFarming
Options.Tooltip: Slower farming and less eggs. Aboveground plants need 1 season, underground plants 4 seasons to grow.

Options.Name: optBtnHarderMining
Options.Tooltip: Adds coal dust and warpstone. Both might hurt your miners when mined.

Options.Name: optBtnHarderLearning
Options.Tooltip: All dwarves learn only half as fast. Makes Guilds more important.

Options.Name: optBtnBodyguards
Options.Tooltip: ON gives caravans bodyguards. OFF means that you have to protect them yourself.

Options.Name: optBtnSecrets
Options.Tooltip: NOTE: This will make your game marginally harder. Build wards to protect you. 6 new sly creatures. Watch your game log.

Options.Name: optBtnDiseases
Options.Tooltip: Adds Halfling's disease mod to the game.  Requires the apothecary to treat the diseases. See the manual for more info.

Options.Name: optMultiCavernFlavor
Options.Tooltip: Adds a separate look for each cavern. Might cause eye damage. ;-)

Options.Name: optBtnRegionalWeather
Options.Tooltip: Adds a lot of special rains, fogs and clouds to all kinds of regions.

Options.Name: optBtnRegionalEffects
Options.Tooltip: Adds specific regional effects, like animated dead in evil regions, to all regions. Good biomes heal dwarves for example.

Options.Name: optBtnSmokeEffects
Options.Tooltip: Adds a couple of smoke effects of different colors to workshops. Have no use but to look pretty.

Options.Name: optBtnNobles
Options.Tooltip: Adds the Overseer, for succession forts, a psychiatrist that calms down dwarves, and the old 20D philosopher, as well as a preacher that helps dwarves throwing tantrums.

Options.Name: optBtnBattlecries
Options.Tooltip: Dwarves and other sentient beings will yell insults and comments at each other in the heat of battle. No effect on game play.

Options.Name: optBtnDiplomats
Options.Tooltip: Adds diplomats for both elves and humans. You can finally order trade goods from their caravan again.

Options.Name: optBtnEnglishDwarves
Options.Tooltip: All dwarven names are now in English. Instead of Urist it will read Dagger.

Options.Name: optBtnBuildDimensions
Options.Tooltip: Adds infos to the building names, like 'Gemcutter 3x3', so you can see how large a building is before you build it.

Options.Name: optNumMineralScarcity
Options.Tooltip: 100 - 10000  The lower the value, the more minerals.

Options.Name: optNumCivNumber
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 300  The number of civilizations placed on the map before history begins.

Options.Name: optNumEmbarkPoints
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 10000  The number of points available for skills and equipment when embarking.

Options.Name: optNumEndYear
Options.Tooltip: 2 - 10000  The number of years of history generated for the world.

Options.Name: optNumPopSize
Options.Tooltip: -1 - 100000  Maximum population of civilization members in the world. -1 is unlimited, but dangerous.

Options.Name: optNumMegabeasts
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 999  The number of megabeasts placed at the beginning of history. All megabeasts are placed in equal proportions.

Options.Name: optNumSemibeasts
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 999  The number of semi-megabeasts placed at the beginning of history. They are placed in equal proportions.

Options.Name: optNumNecromancers
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 999  The number of necromancers.

Options.Name: optNumWerebeasts
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 999  The number of different kinds of were-beasts curses that will exist in the world.

Options.Name: optNumTitans
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 999  The number of titans that exist at the beginning of history.

Options.Name: optNumEvilInteractions
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 999  The number of different types of evil region interactions.

Options.Name: optNumDemons
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 999  The number of different types of demons that will be procedurally generated.

Options.Name: optNumDisturbances
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 999  The number of different disturbed dead that can exist in the world.

Options.Name: optNumNightCreatures
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 999  The number of different types of night creatues that will exist.

Options.Name: optNumEvilClouds
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 999  The total different types of evil clouds that can exist.

Options.Name: optNumBogeymen
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 999  The number of different types of bogeymen that will exist.

Options.Name: optNumEvilRains
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 999  The total amount of different evil rains that can exist.

Options.Name: optNumVampires
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 999  The number of different vampire curses that will exist. Curses are all very similar however.

Options.Name: optNumCaveSizeMin
Options.Tooltip: 1 - 500  The minimum cave length and depth.

Options.Name: optNumCaveSizeMax
Options.Tooltip: 1 - 500  The maximum cave length and depth.

Options.Name: optNumMountainCaves
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 800  The number of mountain caves.

Options.Name: optNumOtherCaves
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 800  The number of non-mountain caves.

Options.Name: optBtnVisibleCaves
Options.Tooltip: If disabled, caves will not be marked on the map.

Options.Name: optNumCaverns
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 3  The number of cavern systems. Less caverns may improve FPS. This number does not include Magma or HFS.

Options.Name: optNumOpenMin
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 100  Minimum cavern openness.

Options.Name: optNumOpenMax
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 100  Maximum cavern openness.

Options.Name: optNumMazeMin
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 100  Minimum cavern passageway density.

Options.Name: optNumMazeMax
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 100  Maximum cavern passageway density.

Options.Name: optNumWaterMin
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 100  Minimum cavern water amount.

Options.Name: optNumWaterMax
Options.Tooltip: 0 - 100  Maximum cavern water amount.

Options.Name: optNumAboveCav1
Options.Tooltip: 5 - 99  Z-Levels of stone above the first cavern layer.

Options.Name: optNumAboveCav2
Options.Tooltip: 1 - 99  Z-Levels of earth between the very bottom of the first cavern, and the very top of the second cavern.

Options.Name: optNumAboveCav3
Options.Tooltip: 1 - 99  Z-Levels of earth between the very bottom of the second cavern, and the very top of the third cavern.

Options.Name: optNumAboveMagma
Options.Tooltip: 1 - 99  Z-Levels between the very highest magma, and the very bottom of the third cavern.

Options.Name: optNumAboveHFS
Options.Tooltip: 2 - 99  Uncertain.  Seems to increase the layers of Semi-Molten Rock and the depth of the magma sea. Only valid if magma layer is present.

Options.Name: optBtnMagmaLake
Options.Tooltip: Determines whether the magma sea exists.

Options.Name: optBtnHFS
Options.Tooltip: Determines if the space below the magma sea exists.

Options.Name: optMaskGoodAreas
Options.Tooltip: ###:###:### (0-500)  The amount of good tiles on the map.

Options.Name: optMaskEvilAreas
Options.Tooltip: ###:###:### (0-500)  The amount of evil tiles on the map.
